intro: Edwardsia persica, commonly known as the Persian edwardsia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. It is adapted to survive in dry, hot climates with minimal water requirements. Edwardsia persica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and resilience to harsh conditions.
